title: Let's Stay Together
composer: Al Green / Willie Mitchell / Al Jackson Jr.

musicalLanguage.description: Al Green's Memphis soul masterpiece features sophisticated chord movement with major and minor ninths, chromatic bass motion, and a silky smooth groove. This advanced arrangement includes extended chord voicings, inner voice movement, and a demanding left hand bass line that drives the iconic rhythm. The interplay between the lush harmony and floating melody demands refined coordination.
musicalLanguage.structure: Verse: Fmaj9-Am7-Dm9-Bbmaj7-Am7-Gm7-C9 (4 bars), Chorus: intensified with wider voicings (4 bars)
keyMoments: Bar 1: Fmaj9 — the opening chord sets the silk standard.
Bars 3-4: Bbmaj7 to Gm7 to C9 — the cascading descent that defines the song.
Bars 7-8: The climactic passage with full extended voicings.
teachingGoals: Chromatic bass movement and smooth voice leading
Advanced two-hand coordination with independent rhythms
styleTips: The groove should feel like velvet — smooth but with subtle rhythmic push
Voice each chord carefully — every note in the voicing matters
The bass line is the backbone — make it sing, not just thump

measures.teachingNote: Fmaj9 — lush opening. The eighth notes in both hands must align precisely.
Am7 to Dm9 — melody weaves through the chord tones. Keep it legato.
Bbmaj7 to Am7 — the chromatic bass descent. This is the money move.
Gm7 to C9 — dominant turnaround. The Bb in the bass is the 7th of C.
Chorus — Fmaj9. Melody leaps to C5. Open up the sound.
Bbmaj7 to Am7 — same chromatic bass as before but melody is more active.

measures.rightHand: D4:e F4:e A4:q C5:e Bb4:e A4:q
measures.teachingNote: Dm9 to Gm7 — the climax. Both hands are fully active. Focus on timing.
C9 to Fmaj7 — resolution. The bass walks C-E-F, guiding us home.
